newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Roche certificates ease after H1 result.
newsitem.headline: Roche certificates ease after H1 result.

text.p: Certificates in Roche Holding AG came under strong pressure in pre-bourse trading in Switzerland following the release of its six-month results.
At 0655 GMT Roche certificates were down 175 francs at 13,210/13,260 francs -- or 1.1 percent -- in an otherwise firmer market.
Some dealers said the result -- a 10 percent rise in first half net profit to 2.43 billion Swiss francs -- was disappointing.

On average analysts had forecast a 10.9 percent rise in group net profit, but the forecasts were attached with a lot of uncertainty due to heavy marketing costs in connection with the launch of new drugs.
The most optimistic forecasts had looked for a rise of more than 20 percent, while other forecasts had looked for a slight decline.
